messages.content: ComfyUI-Depth-Anything-Tensorrt is a custom node implementation for ComfyUI that uses the Depth-Anything-Tensorrt model to generate ultra-fast depth maps.
What are the system requirements for ComfyUI-Depth-Anything-Tensorrt?
The system requirements are Python 3.10.12, CUDA 12.3, TensorRT 8.6, and is tested on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS with an A10G GPU.
How does the inference time vary with different models on an RTX4090?
The inference time for Depth-Anything-S is 3 ms, for Depth-Anything-B it is 6 ms, and for Depth-Anything-L it is 12 ms.

Navigate to the ComfyUI `/custom_nodes` directory and clone the repository using `git clone https://github.com/yuvraj108c/ComfyUI-Depth-Anything-Tensorrt.git`. Then, change to the new directory and install the requirements with `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
How do I build a Tensorrt Engine for ComfyUI-Depth-Anything-Tensorrt?
Download an ONNX model from the Hugging Face repository and use the `trtexec` command to convert it to an engine, then place the engine in ComfyUI `/models/depth_trt_engines` directory.
The document states that Windows is not tested.
What are the sources for ComfyUI-Depth-Anything-Tensorrt?
